meanings.definition: Able to be thrown away or disposed of.
meanings.sent1: The old broken toy was discardable and no longer useful.
meanings.sent2: Please put all the discardable items in the trash bin.
meanings.sent3: The discardable paper airplane flew only a short distance before crashing.
meanings.sent4: Her discardable excuses were like empty promises, easily forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The discardable plastic bag fluttered in the wind, a symbol of waste.

meanings.definition: Something that can be discarded or gotten rid of.
meanings.sent1: He sorted through the pile of discardable items to find something useful.
meanings.sent2: The bin was full of discardable objects waiting to be thrown away.
meanings.sent3: The discardable at the bottom of the pile turned out to be a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the old book was just another discardable cluttering her space.
meanings.sent5: The discardable clutter in the garage made it hard to find anything.
